title: Drake Maye, limited at Patriots practice, says his shoulder is ‘just fine’
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots "This is a game I've dreamed of playing in, so looking forward to getting out there and getting a chance to play in the Super Bowl.
" Drake Maye had no problem celebrating a successful kick by Andy Borregales inside the Patriots' practice bubble.

title: Former Boston Children’s anesthesiologist gets 22 years for child exploitation offenses
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Crime Christopher Sheerer, 37, was charged with multiple child pornography and exploitation charges.
A former Boston Children’s anesthesiologist was sentenced to 22 years in prison on Tuesday for child pornography and other child exploitation charges, prosecutors announced.

Christopher Sheerer, 37, was arrested in July 2024 and pleaded guilty to one count of distribution of child pornography, one count of possession of child pornography, and one count of sexual exploitation of children in September 2025, the office of the U.

title: Mike Vrabel reacts to Bill Belichick’s Hall-of-Fame snub
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots "I'm sure that Bill will get into Canton.
” Mike Vrabel expects to see Bill Belichick enshrined in Canton next year.

AP Photo/Mark Zaleski By Conor Ryan January 29, 2026 | 6:54 PM 2 minutes to read FOXBOROUGH — Count Patriots head coach Mike Vrabel among those surprised that his former coach Bill Belichick will not be a first-ballot entrant into the Pro Football Hall of Fame.

title: Ben Brown is heading to the Super Bowl 59 years after his grandfather played in the first one
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots Allen Brown was a member of the Green Bay Packers' Suepr Bowl I and II championship teams.
Now, grandson Ben gets to play in Super Bowl LX with the Patriots.
Ben Brown AP Photo/Bart Young FOXBOROUGH — When the Patriots take the field for Super Bowl LX in San Francisco, offensive lineman Ben Brown will be following in his grandfather’s footsteps.

title: He’s running Boston for his Six Star medal — in his father’s honor
author: Kelly Chan
bullets: Boston Marathon "I carry a little airplane with his ashes, so he is still sharing these accomplishments with me.

title: More than 650 voted: Readers split on joining the anti-ICE ‘National Shutdown’
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Readers Say Some readers say anti-ICE shutdown is a meaningful way to push back.

title: What Mike Vrabel said about Drake Maye’s shoulder injury
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots “I try not to have a whole lot of concern.
" Drake Maye is dealing with a shoulder injury.

(AP Photo/Ashley Landis) By Conor Ryan January 29, 2026 | 4:06 PM 1 minute to read FOXBOROUGH — Drake Maye might have landed on the Patriots’ simulated injury report on Wednesday evening, but Mike Vrabel isn’t sounding any alarms over the health of his quarterback more than a week away from Super Bowl LX.

title: State Police trooper charged with kidnapping, domestic violence
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Crime Joseph Ward allegedly shoved his then-girlfriend to the floor, charged at her with fists full of kitchen knives, and refused to let her leave their apartment.
A Massachusetts State Police trooper casts a shadow on a backdrop during a press conference.
Jessica Rinaldi / The Boston Globe, File By Abby Patkin January 29, 2026 | 3:57 PM 3 minutes to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.
